website_summaries.verdict: A set of handsome pans from a leading company; heavy-duty aluminum is great for baking.
pros: Bakes evenly due to superior heat conductivity
cons: Be sure to follow care instructions, including hand-washing

customer_reviews.title: USA Pan worked better
customer_reviews.text: I ordered both these Nordicware pans and USA pans at the same time, and used them both for the first time, so there's no difference in age etc. I baked gingerbread cookies, and as you can see the ones baked on the Nordicwear pans cracked and I needed a spatula to scrape them off and some of the bottoms were left on the pan whereas the USA Pan cookies baked smooth and came off easily without a spatula needed. This is based off one time only and both new, so I can't speak to the wear of either or anything other than these cookies, so take this review as you will
customer_reviews.author: smt716

customer_reviews.title: The logo is unnecessary and just annoys me!
customer_reviews.text: I love sheet pans similar this and have owned many in my lifetime. Everyone else I know must love them too, as my supply of five sheet pans had dwindled down to two. I needed more - so I ordered these since they were so well reviewed. When they got here I was really disappointed in two things: specifically they feel a little lighter weight than the ones I've owned in the past, and they have a sizable raised logo that stretches across about a third of the bottom of pan – which is exactly what I don't want – I don't want one more place for gunk to get stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Eric & Kim

customer_reviews.title: Jelly roll is the size to buy!
customer_reviews.text: I love the jelly roll size. Two of these fit perfectly in the oven on the rack. They are much easier to clean than one huge pan, plus easier to store inside cabinets. It is very well-made with measurements exactly as described. These are by far the most frequently used item in my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: WontonUk1

customer_reviews.title: Warped Immediately!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 8 of these as a Christmas present for my spouse. I was confident this would be a great purchase thanks to the many good reviews. Now I'm wondering how many reviews were "plants." Used a pan for the first time today. It warped as soon as it touched the preheated oven rack!! The sheet itself was room temperature, so there was no unreasonable thermal shock. This is completely unacceptable. I suppose the other 7 sheets will do the same thing. I'm very disappointed with my purchase. Seems that Amazon reviews aren't much more than initial impressions of products and borderline useless.
customer_reviews.author: PB_Blimp

customer_reviews.title: After few months of use, you will notice that a grey substance is left behind!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a great baking sheet at first but after 4 months of using this baking sheet 1-2X/week, I now notice that when I wipe down the sheet with a paper towel, there is a noticeable layer of grey substance that is left behind (aluminum). No matter how I wash this baking sheet or wipe it down with a paper towel, there is always some debris behind. I have never put this baking sheet in the dishwasher. I would NOT buy this product again for this reason or recommend it. I now feel like the aluminum has been transferred to the food without my knowing, as I do not use parchment paper.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Impressive and indispensable!
customer_reviews.text: These are impressive! They don't warp, which is crucial when using to bake cakes. They fit side by side on my oven racks so I can have 4 jelly roll sized sheets baking, roasting, or reheating at once. I typically use parchment paper to line, therefore clean up is a snap. These Nordic Ware Natural Aluminum Sheets are indispensable and I wish I found them sooner!
customer_reviews.author: AMZNaddict

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pans; clarification on dishwasher use
customer_reviews.text: It’s everything it’s supposed to be as far as performance. To clarify the dishwasher issue, care instructions say putting in dishwasher is not advised due to discoloration caused by dishwasher detergent, but expressly says this discoloration will not affect performance or safety. We decided that shiny objects in the form of pans weren’t important to us so we put in the dishwasher using Cascade Platinum dishwasher pods. It caused discoloration but it isn’t ugly and it doesn’t have any effect on performance.
customer_reviews.author: Tim N.

customer_reviews.title: Completely discolored and leaving residue
customer_reviews.text: Our baking sheets are completely discolored and leave a gray residue if you run your finger or paper towel on them. They must be defective. We have only used them a couple times. I have an email into the company and will update this review if I hear back from them.
customer_reviews.author: Alissa

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Pan: RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.text: I used this pan to bake a double box white (poke) cake with a Cool- whip & fruit topping to announce our baby's gender (Team Blueberry or Team Strawberry?!?!) to the family. Having the (hard plastic) lid was a MUST as I did not want to smush down the top of the cake as it was stored in the fridge with other party foods. The lid fits/ snaps on well/ securely. This pan baked the cake evenly. Lightweight. Durable. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kurbz

customer_reviews.title: Logo molded into the pan
customer_reviews.text: They've messed up a perfect pan by molding their logo into the bottom. So the once easy to maintain sheet pan now has a built-in cleaning problem.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Truitt

customer_reviews.title: Quality of 2019 model not the same as the 2017 one
customer_reviews.text: I bought nordicware jelly roll pan 2 years ago and was very happy with its quality and finish. I bought one last week and I am disappointed that they have switched to an inferior quality pan. Its not as heavy gauge as the previous one. It’s slightly lighter in weight, which I presume will affect baking times and quality of baked goods. And I cannot understand why did they have embossed logo on the top side of the pan! It leaves marks on base of cakes, breads etc. which I kind of hate. Earlier pan had a nice plain smooth base and the branding was on the underside of the pan.
customer_reviews.author: Neha A

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I just received these and handwashed them to get the "sticky" off of them from the labels and how they were stuck together. I used a plastic scrubber sponge to get the stuck remains off and THEY SCRATCHED!!! If a plastic scrubber sponge scratched them, what happens to them when food gets stuck on them??? If I had not already thrown out my scratched up, old cooking sheets, I would return these!!!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine A. Kinser

customer_reviews.title: Cannot be washed without holding water.
customer_reviews.text: These pans looked fine at first, but after three washes, I noticed a sloshing sound, and confirming my suspicion, I tapped the pans. They're two layers of sheet metal, and hand washing has trapped water inside... Since then, the pans have begun to stink when heated from the tepid water inside... This of course makes them completely useless for actual cooking purposes.
customer_reviews.author: A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good quality metal, surprisingly versatile
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly in most toaster ovens, and quality metal won't warp. Great for individual sized portions and appetizers. I'd also gotten the other Nordic ware sheets (quarter and half) before purchasing this, and all have replaced pretty much everything I had been using up to this point. I also use foil when cooking pretty much anything to save on the cleanup, but the one time I did get cooked on grease, a soak + scrubbing with bar keeper's friend cleans it right up.
customer_reviews.author: A. E. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Most Terrible Product I've Bought on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Maybe buy this if you plan on NEVER washing it. I washed it in the dishwasher ONCE and it looks like some rusted pan you could find at a garbage dump. I don't know how they're legally allowed to sell something this low-quality, but please save yourself some time and money by buying some other product. I've never been so mad after buying something so basic on amazon. smh.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Big enough for Bacon!!
customer_reviews.text: I finally found a quality sheet that fills my entire oven (with 3/4" on each side) and is big enough for an entire package of bacon (24oz, thick-sliced). I purchased the correspondingwhich allows for perfectly cooked, flat, crispy bacon every time. Add a little foil, clean-up is a breeze. This is quality cookware that doesn't warp or bend-- it costs a little more that the others but I think it's totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: TxF

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to use when defrosting frozen meat
customer_reviews.text: I mainly bought these to use instead of a dinner plate when defrosting meat in the fridge because the shape is more compact and is better suited to contain any moisture that results, as well as any possible leakage. But the pans are of course also great for regular or toaster oven use. They’re nice and thick and do not warp in the oven.
customer_reviews.author: Annette B.

customer_reviews.title: These are horrible cookie sheets
customer_reviews.text: These are horrible cookie sheets! My beautiful butter cookies completely stuck to the pans and couldn't get removed from the pan and ended in crumples! Tried twice and both time they failed me! I hate those cookies sheets. What a waste of my time, energy, and all the ingredients!
customer_reviews.author: L. Gao

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to slide in and out of the oven
customer_reviews.text: Overall the pans are heavy gauge and a nice size. Much more heavy duty than what I'm used to and no issues with warping. However, the problem is in the actual hardness of the pans. One of the pans is very difficult to slide in and out of the oven. The aluminum on this one pan is much softer and as a result, the oven rack digs into the pan and makes it impossible to slide. Essentially I have to lift the entire pan and place it down on the rack which can be difficult if its full of food. The other pan works fine. They need better quality control over their materials.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sheets, no discoloring if you follow use & care instructions
customer_reviews.text: Excellent heat conductivity, perfect for making. Each baking sheet has different use in my kitchen. Jelly roll sheet is usually for baking cookies or pizza. Quarter sheet is perfect for baking frozen croissant for the family. Half sheet is too big to fit into European standard size oven, so I mostly use it with a cooling grid to catch crumbs. I handwash the sheets so have no discoloring problems. Use and care instructions are very clear and explicitly stated that dishwasher use is not advised. Don’t understand why people keep putting aluminum pan in dishwasher and complain about discoloration. Read the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. Makes best cookies/biscuits
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea that a cookie aheet could make such a difference in how good your cookies or biscuits turned out! I thought I was always a bad baker because my bottoms would burn and not cook evenly but it turns out all I needed was these! I would mention that I didnt realize you should use parchment paper with these which is no problem since it helps make everything bake awesome but it is one extra step I didnt realize.
customer_reviews.author: Ivy Williams

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: I used these pans twice and they are tarnished and looked disgusting. Metal is all stained and looks terrible. I even used foil both times while cooking and hand washed them afterward. I will be throwing these away!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handy for nights when the rest of the family is out! Or in.
customer_reviews.text: These are what you want when cooking for one: one chicken breast (half), one cup of green beans, a handful of nuts to roast, one bunch of asparagus, etc. I can’t vouch for its durability yet, but it is easy to clean and don’t ever put it in the dishwasher! PAM is your friend. A little spritz and most everything will come right off with a scrubbie sponge and some dish soap.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Hasenstab

customer_reviews.title: Needs more "lid room"
customer_reviews.text: Good cake pan, but the lid isn't all that accommodating. It fits the pan fine and stays closed, but the height of the lid isn't sufficient (it's the very same lid that comes with Nordic Ware's baker's half-sheet). I made a rather tall sheet cake for July 4th, and after I was done decorating it, I put the lid on the pan only to realize that the top of my cake was going to be a bit crushed. I contacted Nordic Ware to see if they make a taller lid for this pan (sold separately), but they don't. My opinion, if the cake pan is 2 inches deep... then the lid should have that much room as well.
customer_reviews.author: M. Crowhurst

customer_reviews.title: A highly recommended essential in any kitchen.
customer_reviews.text: This pan does everything from baking, roasting, mise en place container; service platter, jello pan.... In other words, a kitchen workhorse. It's light weight but very sturdy. The rolled rim keeps the pan from warping in the oven. Did I mention it also bakes a mean sheet cake? The great thing? It won't cost you an arm and a leg. In fact, I own a few of these and they are used everyday for something. I prefer these to the standard sheet cake pan because of the high sides.
customer_reviews.author: Wil

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best overall
customer_reviews.text: We've been using a pair of these for several years now, and decided to rid the house of all those old non-stick and steel sheet pans we've had for decades. Now, having 4 Nordic Ware half sheets available it's a breeze making large batches of pretty much anything we bake! I use them for cookies, roasting squash for winter, wings, you name it- they work perfect every time. Even better- there are parchment paper sheets available that fit these perfectly, and make cleanup less than a minute most of the time! GREAT product, we love these pans
customer_reviews.author: P. Tower

customer_reviews.title: One flaw.....
customer_reviews.text: An ok product with one big flaw......I wash dishes by hand, but I think the same issue would occur with a dishwasher too. I wash it, lean it up let it dry, then when I put it away.......it drips on my foot! The rolled edge holds water.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it love it
customer_reviews.text: Great baking sheet! It’s big enough to use in my oven and when I bake cookies for the holiday. This thing rocks. This is my first natural aluminum cooking baking sheet. I used to own the steel one with nonstick spry I think I’ll never go back. Because it’s lightweight and does not rust. I love it. After couple of weeks of using it. here is the update. STILL GOOD AS NEW! The cleaning process is very easy just simple soap and light scrub everything is off. no burnt marks either. I DO NOT recommend to put this thing in dishwasher. hand wash only!
customer_reviews.author: Flying Sriracha

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and perfect roasting pan
customer_reviews.text: I bought this high sided sheet pan while researching roasting pans for Thanksgiving turkey. I read an article that basically said a roasting pan wasn't necessarily and the optimal tool was a sheet pan with a metal rack, which is inexpensive and optimal for heart circulation around the turkey. If it's good enough for bon Appétit, it's good enough for me. This worked amazingly well! What I also love is that it's double duty and an be used as a regular sheet pan. Its also slim and stacks nicely with my regular sheet pans to save space since storage is really limited in my place. Highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Warped at first use (within suggested baking guidelines)
customer_reviews.text: Always loved their products until now. I’m very disappointed in Nordic Ware, the first use of the pans (used within guidelines for use) and they warped! And now they won’t unwarp. The frame portion is solid but the flat metal sheet moves back and forth and no longer sits flat. I’m returning all 3 pans I just bought from them.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: I don't really recommend these.
customer_reviews.text: these came in a big box and the bottles of dove body wash I ordered were thrown in. they managed to dent these pans, then came open and soaked them in soap. these were a gift and I didn't have time to return them. the recipient told me that where they were dented, the covering has already started to peel. so, no, I don't really recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Joan I Burns

customer_reviews.title: Good Pans, Bad Packaging
customer_reviews.text: The item itself is excellent quality! Hefty and solid, not sure about ease of cleaning yet bacause I'm afraid that the following issue will damage them permanently if allowed to get wet and rust. The packaging is a serious problem. The pans were shipped stacked together with a circle of glue at one end of each pan, with a loose piece of cardboard encircling the stack. This allowed the pans to scratch against each other pretty severely in transit. Not sure why Nordicware thought this was a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Dykstra

customer_reviews.title: Both Nordicwear trays were damaged.
customer_reviews.text: I just unwrapped my two half sheet trays & was disappointed. One tray (2nd two pictures)had scratches on it which worries me if it will continue to scratch & items stick to it. The second tray was dented (1st two pictures), something I was surprised to find on a brand new item. As I planned on using them for Thanksgiving, not sure I’ll be able to now.
customer_reviews.author: CELIAB

customer_reviews.title: Warped After One Use! Beware these are not the good old Nordic Ware pans!
customer_reviews.text: I got rid of my stained workhorse Nordic Ware half-sheet because my companion wanted new, shiny pans. BIG MISTAKE! Pan warped after first use, which was baked cod at 400 degrees for 20 minutes. I will upload video when I get a chance and you will not believe it. These pans are not as thick or sturdy as my old pan which I actually bought on Amazon just three years ago. Should have kept my old pan and barkeeper's friend-ed it. These pans should last a lifetime but they are junk!
customer_reviews.author: MiamiDanny

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe finish
customer_reviews.text: After one go through the dishwasher the finish on this pan completely failed. Metal powdery junk rubbing off of it onto my hands (and food if I would use it). What a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: J W

customer_reviews.title: Nice Pans
customer_reviews.text: I've never been a baker, but hubby likes to bake occasionally. I finally got rid of the ratty cheap pans we had and bought these for him, as he went through a Christmas Cookie baking phase last November. These are really nice! They almost (but not quite) make me want to start baking. I do use them though for other things like roasting veggies in the oven. Wish I had used these years ago!
customer_reviews.author: boumerlin

customer_reviews.title: use, you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This is a review for a used pan, described as "major cosmetic damage, but still usable". I didn't spend much on them but im still disappointed I suppose, so I can't complain much, but I will. The pan came with a massive dent on the side, that affects how flat it is. They must have gotten hit by some machinery. The massive dent is making the whole bottom of the pan a bit warped. Which sucks! The whole point of a nicer pan is that it stays flat. A pre bent pan doesn't really pas muster to me. So I got a great deal on these pans, but they aren't really worth more that what I paid for them.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Hollocher

customer_reviews.title: Too light weight for the money
customer_reviews.text: These baking pans are certainly adequate. Definitely much lighter in weight than the heavier commercial ones. They just can't hold up to repeated use; I use baking pans daily (roasting vegetables, catching drips under pies while they bake, using them for actual baking. I made a sheet pie and the logo left an impression on the crust. I am returning them. For not much more, there are other pans that are work horses.
customer_reviews.author: nancy the navigator

customer_reviews.title: I love this large baking/cookie sheet!
customer_reviews.text: I love this commercial baking sheet! We use it to make everything from cookies, baked spiced chicken to stuff Portobello Mushrooms. If you put this in the dishwasher it will turn an awful color. So please read and believe that this is a HANDWASH and DRY ONLY pan. It is easy to clean and stays beautiful looking with HANDWASHING AND DRYING IMMEDIATELY. Our Silpat Premium Non-Stick Silicone Baking Mat, Half Sheet Size, 11-5/8 x 16-1/2 fits this pan as well. There may be a tiny bit of the edge showing. Not a problem though. I have ordered two more :) Plus the smaller Commercial Size Half sheets. I won't buy anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Passing Through

customer_reviews.title: Baking sheet arrived today and looks solid and sturdy. Deducted one star because the rim is dented
customer_reviews.text: Baking sheet arrived today and looks solid and sturdy. Deducted one star because the rim is dented. Shouldn't affect the usability of the product, but surprised that it was damaged. Bought two of the smaller baking sheets as well and they both are also dented. Again, not enough to go through the trouble of sending them back, but makes me wonder if the seller is trying to pass of seconds as new. Just something to be aware of. When three out of three baking sheets have dents it's suspect at that point.
customer_reviews.author: David Kinsman

customer_reviews.title: 1/8th sheet pan
customer_reviews.text: Great little pan for small things when you don't need a great big cookie sheet. Also, fits in the small broiler/convection oven. Excellent quality. Will not warp even in high temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.....
customer_reviews.text: I was trying out a new recipe for barbecue chicken and she recommended these. They are amazing and I don't know how I've been cooking all of these years without one. I had a ton of baked on, hardened barbecue sauce after dinner - and allowed the tray to soak in hot water and dish soap and in about 15 minutes I used my dish brush and managed to get it clean with no problem. I would not recommend "scouring" otherwise you could scratch the surface and it will end up looking kind of yucky - but with a tiny bit of elbow power and a sponge - it can come clean easy enough.............using Dawn Foam works really good too.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: no problems
customer_reviews.text: wash them as soon as I got them. used them the other day with parchment custom paper bought from Amazon. works well, no warping, no heat tinting, still looks like out of the package. good heavy product. just got to know how to use them. comes with warning about being cleaned in the dish washer. so I am not sure why people complain about the discolor when they put it in the dish washer, got to read the instructions people
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Kareski

customer_reviews.title: Good pan, good covers
customer_reviews.text: These are good pans at a good price. Just line them with parchment, and you're good to go. No, they're not heavy duty like the USA pans, but they are great for cake baking. Typical aluminum. They don't over brown your cake. The covers are fantastic, and honestly, the main reason I bought these. The covers fit well, and I can use them for my other pans, sheet pans too. I'm Buying two more.
customer_reviews.author: BRENDIE

customer_reviews.title: Pans arrived scratched up
customer_reviews.text: I am excited to use these pans and get rid of my cheap, non-stick pans that have gotten damaged and even rusty. I’m a little disappointed that these pans arrived with scratches already on them — presumably from where they rubbed on each other — hence the 4 stars instead of 5. I think this could have been avoided with a layer of acid-free paper between each pan. (Updated to 5 stars as I’ve been very pleased with the baking quality and with how easy they are to clean.)
customer_reviews.author: A. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, sturdy, great quality.
customer_reviews.text: A really high quality pan. I use this for a multitude of purposes, including as a roaster (I just use an existing roasting rack I had) for my whole pork shoulder, prime rib, or turkey. Because of its low sides (relative to a traditional roaster), my meats get a much more even heat exposure and crispier skin as a result. You can deglaze it on the stovetop easily. Super sturdy, and made in America. Much better than having a $200 roasting pan you'd use maybe 3-4 times a year.
customer_reviews.author: J. M.

customer_reviews.title: These are mine, all mine!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to replace my ugly old discolored Hoffritz. They did a great job, but I just couldn't look at them anymore. I love that these are lightweight compared to what I used to have. I also treated myself and purchased some silpat mats for them. I still have kids in the house (between college and life...) but they aren't allowed to use these, either is hubby. I want to keep them nice as long as I can. I've made scones and cookies on them so far and had very even baking. I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Socalgal428

customer_reviews.title: Way too good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I was really surprised at how sturdy these pans are at such a reasonable price. My baking pans were all junk because restaurant cooks survive on late night chicken nuggets so why have good pans? Former pro cook with 20 years in the business. But with the lock down I started baking again and those junk pans weren't cutting it. I thought I'd get some medium quality pans but these Nordics are a steal. Easy to clean, hold their shape just fine in recommended Temps. Nice weight. Just enough to feel substantial when transferring from oven.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for sheet pan meals
customer_reviews.text: Love these pans. I need a pan that stays flat when I put it in a 475 degree oven. I have become addicted to sheet pan meals and my old pans were not large enough or would warp at high heat. I line them with parchment paper so clean-up is a breeze. Sheet pan meals are the best because I can make a large amount.
customer_reviews.author: TXk

customer_reviews.title: Discolored
customer_reviews.text: So the circles on the pan were not seen, but I did use them underneath my silicone muffin tray while baking. That’s okay. My problem is that the rest of the dark discoloration on the tray just happened after I used both trays to cook bacon. I have been scrubbing, soaking, and tried different things... but the awful discoloration won’t go away after the bacon. I’m beyond disappointed. I originally reviewed these as 5 stars, I’ve now changed my review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT BAKING SHEET!
customer_reviews.text: "Nordic Ware Natural Aluminum Commercial Baker's Big Sheet" I highly recommend! This Is the exact dimensions to fit inside my home oven!!! No space wasted in my oven with this sheet. Perfectly fits, I can place double the number of cookies to bake on it. Cuts down the time to load and reload cookies when holiday baking. The QUALITY of the sheet AND the SIZE is perfect. Thank you Nordic Ware for caring about we ladies baking at home.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wilkerson

customer_reviews.title: Nice Value and High Quality
customer_reviews.text: Have been super pleased with these pans. Very little to no flex, even heat distribution. Different than my old nonstick pans which flexed and warped. Reasonable price. Cookies, potato wedges, scratch pizza and other items have come out great. I’ve only used these pans with parchment paper or nonstick foil and plan to do only that, so there really hasn’t been any major cleanup to comment on, per se... they look like they day I got them. Great value and would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: decadeindc

customer_reviews.title: No warping!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after reading an article rating baking sheets. This one rated as one of the best they tested (possibly the best, I can't recall) and they stated it did not warp. I bought these for just that reason - and they have not warped. They have been used numerous times with many different types of food and each time they performed fabulously. They are also easy to clean - a definite plus. They look nice and feel sturdy. These are keepers and I will be giving as gifts to my cooking friends.
customer_reviews.author: Shinorma

customer_reviews.title: Great for toaster ovens
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace the pan that came with my old toaster oven. This is the perfect size replacement. I don't use microwaves so rely on my toaster oven daily to quickly heat up food. This sheet pan is perfect for that use. Food rarely sticks and it cleans up easily.
customer_reviews.author: Christina G

customer_reviews.title: The best baking sheet!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a set of these years ago at Costco and they are simply the best. I love the largest size as it still fits in a standard oven, but it allows so much space for baking. I make a lot of sheet pan dinners and this is plenty of room for chicken/meat on one side and veggies on the other side. Great quality and feels like it will last forever. I usually use parchment bc I am lazy and don't love to scrub, and after many years of use they are looking great!
customer_reviews.author: browniegirl

customer_reviews.title: Warps in oven
customer_reviews.text: This product was not supposed to warp in the oven, but cooking my salmon at 425 degrees tonight, it did. Definitely returning.
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: Pan sticks & easily scratched
customer_reviews.text: Puechased in 2 sizes, good sized pans, however they are NOT nonstick pans. Good if using cookung spray or parchment paper. They also scratch eaily, even with storage with other pans. I had to turn them upside down in cabinet to prevent scratches. Will not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Saab B.

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: I bought these pans because they were recommended by a review in Bon Appetit. My older sheet pans were non stick and wearing out. I’m very sorry I purchased these pans. Big design flaw in the way the edges are rolled under. When washing them, lots ofwater gets trapped in the rolled over rim and takes minutes of maneuvering to get the water to all drain out. I don’t want to put pans away in my cupboard that are full of water for obvious reasons. I’m going to get rid of these. Not worth the bother.
customer_reviews.author: Photokent

customer_reviews.title: CAn't rust, easy to clean, fit well with the Kitchenatics 100% Stainless Steel Cooling trays
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to go with the cooling trays for baking bacon and using to drain friend chicken coming out of a deep fryer. They work quite well, and I like them better than any of my non-stick steel ones. Those inevitably generate rust inside the seams where they are rolled at the edges so you have to be careful to let that area drain after a wash to avoid having rust drips inside your cabinets. These obviously aren't going to rust since they are aluminum.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Nice pan, wish it was heavier
customer_reviews.text: It's the perfect jelly roll pan. I had a hard time finding 10 x 15" but this is exactly that. Perfect for my grandma's special pan cookie recipe. I just wish it was a heavier gauge metal like my other jelly roll pan I have (that I can't remember where I got.) I haven't used it yet, but I will definitely update this review if this pan pops (warps) when it's put in the oven. That's a complete deal breaker for me. Pans should lay flat in and out of the oven or they're made wrong in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Centsless1

customer_reviews.title: Magic ingredient of your kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these for years. Just bought two more for a craft project. I never use cookie sheets anymore. The professional half sheet pan is the workhorse of any kitchen. I bake almost everything on them. Cookies, chicken, veggies... etc. Use parchment paper and cleanup is a breeze. When I make a 13x9 cake, I flip it out onto one of these for frosting/serving. I’ve used it as a tray for dinner on the couch. You won’t regret having these in your kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Dog Owner

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy so far with this product. I lined it with parchment paper and baked sliced potatoes and the potatoes cooked evenly. My old pan always made the potatoes on the four corners more crispy (cooked faster), so this was a pleasant surprise. I will never buy a coated pan again if this pan cooks everything like this! Also, some liquid ended up under the parchment (my fault), and the clean up was better than a coated pan! No scrubbing even though it was browned.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Good pans, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I dislike about these is the embossed logo isn't as easy to clean as a flat surface would be. It would be nice if the logo wasn't pressed through into the top surface. Other than that, these are excellent sheet pans. Jelly roll is a nice size for a smaller oven or if you don't do a lot of baking, but I'd recommend the half sheet if you want to use it with silicone mats and do standard batch sizes for recipes.
customer_reviews.author: NH

customer_reviews.title: I gave these as a gift
customer_reviews.text: Previously I had purchased cookie sheets at Costco. Costco did not have any in stock so I purchased these online here at Amazon. I was a little disappointed as they are not the quality of Costco's cookie sheets. The ones here are smaller, are not double insulated, and do not look as attractive as Costco's. I still gifted them to my friend.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Brisker

customer_reviews.title: Seems thin, not what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: We retur ed this pan due to reasons not related to the product itself. That said, I was looking for a set of heavy duty aluminum pans like I used to have before our move. The 2/3rd size pans seem difficult to find. Nordic was well reviewed, and appeared heavy duty, but the gauge of the metal is not listed in Amazon, or Nordic's own site. Appears to be 18 or 19 gauge. I am probably looking for something in the 14 gauge range, which also seems hard to find.
customer_reviews.author: aldridgec

customer_reviews.title: I have 6 of these pans!
customer_reviews.text: Okay. I have 6 Nordic Ware pans, now! This size is my new favorite. One word of caution: Do NOT put these in the dishwasher. It anodizes the pans. BUT, they can be fixed with lemon juice and steel wool. I learned this the hard way! So glad I didn’t throw the pan away! Please invest in these pans, you won’t be sorry!
customer_reviews.author: B Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Rusted immediately
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews before ordering these and followed the advice people gave about heat distribution and cleaning. But the pans immediately rusted after the first time I used them. Even their texture changed so they’re no longer smooth aluminum. I’m likely going to throw them out because it feels so gross to touch them.
customer_reviews.author: Ro et Pep

customer_reviews.title: Decent baking sheets
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t found better baking sheets than these. For the price I think they’re pretty decent. We use them at high temps sometimes and I’ve never had an issue with their warping. Their main drawback is that you can’t put them in the dishwasher without tarnishing them and ruining the smooth surface. We don’t usually use them to roast things with fat or juices that drip a lot and bake on, so washing by hand is usually not too onerous. We also use metal grids a silicone mats with them all the time. They pair well.
customer_reviews.author: Canfam

customer_reviews.title: Horrifying Quality!!!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe how poor the quality is with these baking sheets! Even after multiple washings, the gray aluminum powder still wipes off on paper towels. The metal micro-bits obviously transfer to food items while baking in the oven. There should be a warning on this product to only use with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat. Even then, there is still potential to inhale or consume the metal dust; in my opinion, because the product was not coated or sealed in production. This is a SERIOUS HEALTH HAZARD!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Nordic is one of the best kitchen supplies that I could have bought. Tired of old pans sticking and not baking right? Me too, actually my wife talked me into it. But once the pans arrived I could see they are worth every penny. They are sturdy and the lids fit well. We cooked in it and the food turned out Great. All in all a quality product. I would advise to get the no stick pads also, they help protect your pans, and also make your cookies slip right off. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Vance

customer_reviews.title: What Every Kitchen Needs
customer_reviews.text: Bakers sheets are invaluable all-purpose tools of the kitchen. As simple as they are to make, good ones, like this Nordic Ware are worth their weight in gold, and bad ones, like the ones I am replacing aren't worth their weight in aluminum foil. These sheets are very sturdy, and do not bend or warp during cooking (the sure sign of a mediocre sheet). Nevertheless, they are not to heavy, especially when loaded with food.
customer_reviews.author: A. Silverstone

customer_reviews.title: Scratches Easily
customer_reviews.text: Be mindful if you buy these that they scratch very easily. Do not use scrubber brush on them to wash them. Do not slide them on to your oven racks unless you want the entire back to be scratched up. Used them twice since purchased and they are shiny new but the damage due to oven racks, pizza cutter, and washing make them look like I have had them for decades. Ridiculous. Such a good company, with a great reputation, I am shocked that for the price they are not very sturdy at all.
customer_reviews.author: SFM

customer_reviews.title: Get one!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why I was scared to use a pan that was not non stick. I wish I would have gotten these years ago. I will never go back to using a non stick cookie sheet EVER! I feel so mislead con the fact that I was missing out on great cooking. I use this for everything! The food always comes out great whenever this pan is used. It gives any meat I cook a nice sear. This is easy to clean as well. I never have had any issues with food being stuck. My daughter accidentally put one in the dishwasher. It lost its sheen but it still works great. You will not be disappointed buying these
customer_reviews.author: MamaBearX3

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, huge baking sheets
customer_reviews.text: Somehow between several moves in the past couple of years, I realized we were down to only two baking sheets and both were small and pretty banged up. I saw a deal on these and snagged them. I love them so far! We've been using them regularly for the past month and they've held up well. They are huge- which I LOVE- great for a big batch of roasted veggies or cookies. They haven't gotten stained or warped at all yet and they've been easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for price
customer_reviews.text: These are much better than what you'll find at your local big-box retailer. The rolled edges are great and thickness is good. I'll hold off on commenting about durability. They don't seem to be quite as thick as my old no-name restaurant supply half sheet. I could also do without the logo stamped in the bottom. All in all quite nice for the price.
customer_reviews.author: nova

customer_reviews.title: Quality pan
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before I decided to go with the Nordic Ware Natural Aluminum sheet pans and it paid off in spades. Purchased in 2014 and they are all still holding up perfectly. No warping, good even heat distribution, no staining and clean up is easy.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Haston

customer_reviews.title: Great - but do not put in the dishwasher
customer_reviews.text: My old cookie sheets were worn out and we were way overdue for new ones. These are beautiful and sturdy and work well. The only downside is that they should not be put in the dishwasher. My husband tends to dismiss this type of advice, which was very clear from other reviewers. One wash in the dishwasher discolored our shiny new baking sheet. We're handwashing them from now on. But we still love them and I'd buy them again!
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Espy

customer_reviews.title: Quality pan, but a little too small
customer_reviews.text: These are good quality pans that do not warp, but the interior dimensions are a little off. Neither my generic-brand silicone liners, nor my Silpat fit exactly into this pan - the length is just a little too short. This is problematic when making macarons, as there is one row that cannot be used without having misshapen shells, as the liner climbs the side of the pan. I have other half sheets that fit all of my silicone liners just fine. Additionally, beware that these pans require hand-washing or they will discolor.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie T.

customer_reviews.title: I love these pans
customer_reviews.text: These are so great. We're notorious for letting things go rusty so I bought these specifically because they won't rust. They haven't so far and are super easy to clean. They have been holding up perfecting after going in the dishwasher. The only "kinda bad" thing about them is the metal is really soft and they don't slide in and out of the oven as smoothly as I would like, but it's not a big deal. Really glad I bought them
customer_reviews.author: KLupa

customer_reviews.title: Really great! They do not bend in the oven like other pans do.
customer_reviews.text: I love these and just ordered more. The half sheet is the perfect size. I ordered the checkered chef grate that goes in them and they fit neatly. I plan on cooking all my meats on these (4 pans in the oven at once). These fit a whole package of bacon and will also be able to use for baking. I purchased some parchment sheets too. Good tools in the kitchen make life much easier. Treat yourself! :-)
customer_reviews.author: empress

customer_reviews.title: Best Alum pan I have used!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and USA pan cause I couldnt decide... and was hoping to say there is a clear winner. 3 months later, I’m happy I bought both! They are both winners, this is aluminum where as the USA pan is coated steel. I probably use this pan more because I bought the jelly roll size... size wise it suits my needs better. And I like the heat properties of alum, Quality does not warp! since it’s alum it’s lighter.. rather the steel USA pan is notably heavier than any other pan. Both are great!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pan!
customer_reviews.text: With a product this cheap there's no sense in having a poor baking sheet. My other pans we're popping in the oven even at 375. This pan doesn't make that sound I've cooked at 400 degrees Fahrenheit. Parchment paper is a life saver on clean up. It is December so there will be plenty more cookies cooked on these sheets in the following weeks. Half sheet pans are the perfect size for a dozen cookies in a residential oven. I do think these are high quality, only thing that I dislike is the curl of the lip, it tends to hold water because I don't have a drying rack to hold it sideways unless my dishwasher is empty.
customer_reviews.author: Non Paid Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Ain't No Sheet Like the Sheet I've Got
customer_reviews.text: *starry eyed gaze* Could it be the pan pf my dreams?! Answer: yah. This pan has it all, baby! Full sheet so no more squeezing two ill fitting pans on the same rack. It's easy to clean. It's non-stick. It's everything you want in a baking sheet. Since I bought this back in November I have used it at least 3 times a week and there are some instances where I've used it everyday. SERIOUSLY.
customer_reviews.author: FerristOfThemAll

customer_reviews.title: Declining quality
customer_reviews.text: Quality and QC has declined. Bought a set 6-8 ago I swore by and recommended to others, but this last set has one pan than is very flexible in the middle, which runs the risk of hot oil popping in your face after a temperature change, like the cheap pans my mom buys. The other pan from the set is still not as rigid as my original set. If it’s made in the USA, Nordic Ware should be proud of that stamp and not take it lightly.
customer_reviews.author: TCB

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was to add to our Nordic Ware sheets. Great products. The only gripe I have was there were some scratches on two of the three pans from then rubbing together in shipping. Read the instructions that come with the baking sheets!!! These are NOT dishwasher safe and it is clearly stated on the product’s packaging.
customer_reviews.author: lobo2101

customer_reviews.title: If you have a double oven....
customer_reviews.text: Check the dimensions of the pan and your oven. Know that the edges of this pan flares out. It is not a straight up and down edge and because of this it doesn't fit in my double oven. I can get it in there by inserting it in to the rack slots but it's a tight fit and tough to slide in and out.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Great pans
customer_reviews.text: These Nordicware quarter sheets live up to the review hype. These out perform far more expensive baker's pans and just goes to show, you do not need to spend a ton of money for quality. These do not warp under high heat, compared to ones I bought from other companies which cost double or more. I bought these to use in my Breville Smart Oven Pro. I also bought Hamilton Houseware 8.5x12 cooling racks, which fit perfectly (and I mean perfectly, no sliding around) inside these Nordicware quarter sheets.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy product. Holds about 12 strips of bacon. Holds about 24 cookies.
customer_reviews.text: I use these every day. I use one to cook bacon daily. They clean up nicely. When they get brown with caked on grease I turn on my oven to 500* and bake the sheet for 30 minutes. Let it cool in oven. Rinse with warm water and dry. They come out shiny again.
customer_reviews.author: juju

customer_reviews.title: You want these pans!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best pans I’ve ever owned and I’m ordering them now for my mom. I’ll only buy NordicWare from now on. They cook evenly, haven’t warped at all, and still look great after a while of heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: BusyMommy

customer_reviews.title: Aluminum in food?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 2 months ago and have used it about 8 or 9 times. Before first use I washed it thoroughly with a non-abrasive cloth and soap. Today I went to make cookies on it and after getting the first batch out I wiped it down with a cold paper towel. I then found what you can see in the video. I have contacted nordic to see what they will do. This is a WARNING to anyone who would like to purchase this. If you do, I'd get yourself parchment paper so you don't have aluminum coming off into your food.
customer_reviews.author: StarkTsorian

customer_reviews.title: Great service!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I contacted Nordic Ware by email and got an immediate reply about the missing lid. They are sending the lid! I prefer to buy American made products and will continue to purchase more items from Nordic Ware in the future! This pan is supposed to come with a lid, the pan sent to me didn’t have the lid that I paid for, so I will be returning it 😡
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: POOR quality and IMPOSSIBLE to clean
customer_reviews.text: I was so disapointed with these baking sheets. I use parchment paper for all of my baking and even with the parchment paper the sheets still got dirty and stained badly. Followed proper cleaning instructions and they stained even MORE. I thought with the higher price point these sheets would be worth the cost but its NOT so. Save your money and order something basic!
customer_reviews.author: caroline jordan

customer_reviews.title: DON’T BUY! Cheap material, food juice never comes off.
customer_reviews.text: How these trays got high ratings is beyond me!!! They suck. Everything sticks to them no matter what you do, spray it or wipe oil, the food will not stick but all the juices, oil, drips is here to stay. The pictures shows the trays after 2 and 3 uses for each, and just in case anyone is wondering, no I don’t leave them after use, I wash them immediately afterwards. Lousy piece of cheap garbage. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Ahmad AJ

customer_reviews.title: Poor metal quality
customer_reviews.text: These were very disappointing. As a frequent baker and cook, I bought these because of the rave reviews. However, after just the first wash (not even cooking or heating them yet), the metal acquired a weird type of visual wear on its surface and the shape of the pan began to warp. At first I thought it was soap residue, but it became clear that the actual material is of poor quality and is degrading quickly. These pans are fewer than 6 weeks old but look as if they've been used and abused for months/years.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: Fer' Bakin Cookies and what not!
customer_reviews.text: Picked these up because I had some cheapo pans that were thin and warped and didn't have a very high lip on it. These pans work perfectly, so far I roasted some green beans and brussels sprouts in them and made a batch of cookies. They did not warp or do anything weird and were easy enough to clean. I roasted the veggies at 400 degrees, and baked the cookies at 350. I would by again but i don't think I will need to for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Murphy the Dog

customer_reviews.title: Dents, scratches, and peeled layer
customer_reviews.text: This review is purely about the pans' condition upon arrival. I just received these yesterday and was disappointed to see that the glue that was used to affix the product details had somehow peeled off a layer of the pan. I tried to wash rhe glue off with warm soapy water and a soft sponge but the spot remains so it looks like it's not the glue but that a layer has come off. Also, the second pan had 2 bigger dents in them and scuff marks all along the edges. Feel disappointed because they're supposed to be brand new but already looks used right from the box.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy M.

customer_reviews.title: Great aluminum pan
customer_reviews.text: Need new pans? Get these! Do not pay more at box stores for the same thing. I'm sure you can get cheaper ones from restaurant supply places but i couldnt find any near me. These are light weight and wont POP like metal ones do (since those metal ones warp easy).
customer_reviews.author: Sharrel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe I put off purchasing these! I was able to grab 2 of them during a sale over the holidays, but even not on sale....they are worth the price. I absolutley LOVE them! They just blow my other sheets out of the oven... and I can now not bake or cook in the oven without them. They are a wonderful size, clean up so amazingly easy, and have held up like nobody's business. The best thing is that I don't have to listen to them pop when they get hot (like my other baking sheets). They are just perfect
customer_reviews.author: LivyLynn

customer_reviews.title: The name/logo is stamped into the bottom
customer_reviews.text: It's my fault for not looking more closely at the product photos before I made the purchase. Each pan has the name and logo of Nordicware stamped into the bottom. No, just no. I don't think a baking sheet should ever be designed to have more uneven or not smooth/not level spots for food to stick to. I'm not even going to try them. So, my only negative comment is about the stamped name/logo. If you want smooth or even bottomed baking pans, these are not them. I'm returning the pans without attempting to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly bad quality - scratches galore after two weeks' use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these baking sheets because of the great reviews, and I'm stunned by how bad the quality is. In the past two weeks, I've used one of the pans to bake a single black bean burger, and I used another pan to bake an apple slab pie. There are now multiple scratches on both of the pans. It's like they get a scratch if you so much as look at them! The other baking sheets I had were in the kitchen for over a decade and don't look nearly as bad as these ones do. Really disappointed in the quality and not planning on buying from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: anolinde

product_meta.title: Nordic Ware Natural Aluminum Commercial Baker's Half Sheet (2 Pack), Silver
product_meta.description: Style Name:2-Pack Half Sheet| Design:BakewareNordic Ware's line of Natural Commercial Bakeware is designed for commercial use, and exceeds expectations in the home. The durable, natural aluminum construction bakes evenly and browns uniformly, while the light color prevents overbrowning. The oversized edge also makes getting these pans in and out of the oven a cinch. Proudly made in the USA by Nordic Ware. Aluminum is reactive to acidic ingredients such as vinegar and tomato products. These foods may darken, pit or corrode the pan after prolonged use.
feature_bullets: Naturals commercial bakeware is made of pure aluminum which will never rust for a lifetime of durability. For sweet or savory baking; from cookies to sheet pan dinners, this is the pan you’ll reach for
Foods bake and brown evenly due to aluminum’s superior heat conductivity. Reinforced encapsulated steel rim prevents warping and adds strength
Compatible with parchment paper or silicone baking mats if desired. Easy clean up; hand wash recommended
Pan exterior dimensions 17.88 x 12.88 x 1.06 inches and interior dimensions 16.5 x 11.38 x 1 inches
Proudly made in the USA by Nordic Ware

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars12,672 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
